title: Teenager shot Tuesday was playing with gun, remains hospitalized
content:
STOCK PHOTO
PEORIA - A 15-year-old boy remained hospitalized Wednesday with life-threatening injuries after accidentally shooting himself while playing with a gun Tuesday.
Witnesses told police the boy, who was not identified in a release from the Peoria Police Department, was playing with the handgun when it went off, striking him once in the head.
Police found the boy after an emergency call about 2:25 p.m. He was inside a house in the 2100 block of West Starr Street.
The weapon was recovered, and police notified the Department of Children and Family Services because of the circumstances of the shooting, according to the release.
